The world 's largest mobile network operator , China Mobile , has reported that revenue from short message services peaked in 2009 at nearly $ 9 billion .

Three years later , it is down nearly 20 percent and is expected to drop further China Mobile has attributed this decline to increasing competition in the Chinese wireless market and growing popularity of messaging applications including WeChat , although revenues are expected to increase again through China Mobile 's aggressive expansion in the 3G and 4G markets .
